trial_identification.studytitle: The Effect of Timing of Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) for Enhancing Learning During Cognitive Training
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The Effect of Timing of Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) for Enhancing Learning During Cognitive Training

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: devices - Transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS)
Experimental: Timing of tDCS -
Experimental: Alternative timing of tDCS -
Treatment: devices: Transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) Eldith Direct Current Stimulator (NeuroConn GmbH, Germany)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Change in performance across each condition. - D prime, number of correct responses, and number of errors.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Over 2 days, with each condition conducted 1 month apart.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: - Participants will be healthy right-handed subjects aged 18 to 40 years.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- Concurrent medication likely to affect mental performance,
- Current history of drug or alcohol abuse or dependence,
- Any psychiatric or neurological disorder,
- Recent head injury, or history of seizure or stroke.

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: The University of New South Wales

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This project will investigate a novel strategy for enhancing cognitive training (CT). Specifically, the investigators aim to combine a non-invasive form of brain stimulation (tDCS) with CT. This study will examine the optimal time interval - whether tDCS should be administered either before or during CT.
